root.name: Embryon
root.description: OverviewEmbryon is a science fiction themed pinball machine developed and manufactured by Bally in 1980. Embryon was the last of the five traditional "wide-body" pinball machines to be made by Bally. Embryon was also the only machine produced by Bally that uses what they call the "flipsave". The flipsave was a small flipper located in the right outlane. The flipper could be used to hit the ball back into play.
